ags:resource.dc:title: Hermaphroditism in Ruditapes decussatus (L.) (Bivalvia) from the Galician coast (Spain)
ags:resource.dc:subject: Ruditapes decussatus
carpet-shell clam
hermaphroditism
Galician coast
ags:resource.dc:description: Although Ruditapes decussatus is considered strictly gonochoristic, two individuals showed hermaphroditism in which both male and female gametes are present. It´s suggested that these are cases of consecutive hermaphroditism.
ags:resource.dc:identifier: Delgado, M and A. Pérez Camacho (2002). Hermaphroditism in Ruditapes decussatus (L.) (Bivalvia) from the Galician coast (Spain). Scientia Marina, vol. 66 nº 2 pp: 183-185.
